parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>



</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.
<br>
<br>
''brush'' can be:
* "Solid"
* "SolidFull" (A3 only)
* "Horizontal"
* "Vertical"
* "Grid"
* "FDiagonal"
* "BDiagonal"
* "DiagGrid"
* "Cross"
* "Border"
* "SolidBorder"
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>'''Multiplayer optimisation:''' Global marker commands always broadcast the ''entire'' marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).</value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> markerName '''setMarkerBrush''' brush </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> brush: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>"Marker1" [[setMarkerBrush]] "DIAGGRID";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setMarkerAlpha]], [[setMarkerAlphaLocal]], [[setMarkerBrushLocal]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerColorLocal]], [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerDirLocal]], [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerPosLocal]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerShapeLocal]], [[setMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerSizeLocal]], [[setMarkerText]], [[setMarkerTextLocal]], [[setMarkerType]], [[setMarkerTypeLocal]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
